Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration officer's decision to award 22 points instead of 25 points for the applicant's education was reasonable under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, S.C. 2001, c. 27
Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, SOR/2002-227
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant held two Master's degrees and a diploma; only 16 years counted toward highest degree; diploma did not contribute to Master's progression
Legal_Rule: Points for education awarded based on highest credential and years of study; no cumulative points for multiple credentials at same level
Procedural_Issue: Interpretation of regulatory requirements by visa officer
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged incorrect point assessment for educational qualifications
Key_Evidence_Considered: Master's degrees, diploma, duration of studies in Bangladesh
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged point allocation for education in skilled worker application
Defendant_Response: Officer applied regulations correctly; no special circumstances justifying additional points
Evidence_Type: Educational credentials, official transcripts, regulatory guidelines
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Governing_Rule: Regulatory provisions on point allocation for education in skilled worker applications
